data: PED ED Febrile Neutropenia Unstable Patient

For Unstable Patient - febrile and altered loss of consciousness, hypotension, poor perfusion    - Febrile - oral temperature greater than 38.5C (or greater than 38C x 2 readings 1 hour apart)    - Neutropenic - Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC) less than 1
B.C. Children's Hospital Fever and Neutropenia Guidelines
If patient has Central Venous Line, access all lumens / ports and draw bloodwork
If no Central Venous Line present, start peripheral IV x 2 and draw bloodwork

sodium chloride 0.9% IV bolus   1) Repeat in 20 mL/kg increments up to 60 mL/kg   2) If no response after bolus #2 of Sodium Chloride 0.9%, consider initiation of inotropes  3) If patient develops signs of fluid overload, hold crystalloids and start inotropes  4) Consider using warmed fluids and/or rapid infuser if clinically indicated  5) If 60 mL/kg of crystalloid fluid is given, then mandatory critical care consult
